website_summaries.verdict: The 3100 is a low cost alternative that still delivers a decent shave. Designed for dry shaving, but can be rinsed clean. Women can also use it to shave legs.
pros: Good ergonomic design, feels comfortable in the hand
Blades can be rinsed under running water
cons: Relatively long 8-hour charging time for 45 minutes of use
Does not provide a very close shave

website_summaries.verdict: A sturdy shaver that offers a close shave at a low cost for those who do not need a wet shave option.
pros: This model includes Philips traditional three head alignment, so it provides a close and comfortable shave comparable to some higher priced models
The pop-up trimmer means not having to worry about losing an attachment
The one-touch open makes for easy cleaning
cons: No cordless option means this model is less mobile and cannot be used in the shower

customer_reviews.title: False advertising
customer_reviews.text: Battery charge only lasts for 8 minutes. Why? Because the internal battery is ancient technology Nickel-Cadmium, not Lithium Ion as advertised. I opened the case and the battery is clearly marked "use NiCD battery only" (refer to attached image).
customer_reviews.author: R. Maigret

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up :)
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my son, didn't want him using razors due to bacteria, infections, acne, and just not worth the problems associated with razors. It was a Christmas present, a long waited for gift, because I had to double check whether it was the right choice and price. Answer: Yes. He likes it, says it works, doesn't pull or cut his skin, easy to clean, easy to use, and he can finally keep his fast growing side burns from getting out of control. All in all glad I got it for him.
customer_reviews.author: Divergent

customer_reviews.title: Solid Performer with Nice Touches
customer_reviews.text: I'm an industrial designer, so I appreciate attention to design detail. This replaced an older, higher-end Norelco because this was priced only a little more than new blades for the older model. It is just as hard to keep clean as most shavers of this type, requiring regular complete disassembly of the heads and careful brushing, but this model has two small features that make for MUCH improved usability. (1) The protective cap fits tightly enough so it isn't always falling off in a drawer or case, and (2) the shaver continues to operate while plugged in and charging. The latter is a biggy when you are in a hurry and discover you forgot to recharge.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Constantine

customer_reviews.title: Great shaver at decent price
customer_reviews.text: Well, I took the 3-week challenge that Philips recommends. I was replacing a Norelco model 8240XL that I had for years, and liked. The shave at first was not very close and it tended to pull hairs a bit rather than cut them cleanly. That left both stubble and irritation -- bummer. But, at the 3+ week mark the blades seem to have honed in and the shave is just as close as the 8240 with no pulling or irritation.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Good quality but the beard trimmer is under powered.
customer_reviews.text: I thought I would have to wait for my face to get along with this as well for the product to break in during this period. But it actually caught on quick and works great now. Only complaint is the beard trimmer is dull and under powered. Like just there to meet the specs mostly. The Braun I had was more powerful and you could work a lot with it.
customer_reviews.author: Axcela

customer_reviews.title: Best Shaver I have Ever Purchased
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to see why this shaver is rated so highly. Don't bother looking for this elsewhere. Buy it on Amazon. Why? Because It is sold out everywhere I looked. I have never had a closer shave. And the motor sounds twice as powerful as other shavers I have used. Nicely designed and feels very comfortable in the hand. No wonder it is so popular. Easily beats out other Norelco shavers at half the price!
customer_reviews.author: mgk

customer_reviews.title: Worst electric razor I've ever bought!
customer_reviews.text: I was all excited about this razor due to the large amount of good reviews. I charged it as directed, turned it on and the motor sounded like it was barely running and it was super slow. I thought maybe its supposed to be like that and shaved anyway. I might as well have shaved with a butter knife! It didn't hardly do anything. A $10 razor from Walmart would do better than this thing. I shaved with a disposable razor blade, packed this thing up and will be sending it back to the seller in the morning. Don't waste your money, its a piece of junk!
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Not shaving any closer than my 10-year-old Norelco 7310XL with 6-year-old blades
customer_reviews.text: Headline says it all. The cord for my old razor was fraying, and the battery only lasts one shave, and the blades were 6 years old. New cord $ + new blades $ = only slightly cheaper than this razor (well, the 10-hour-charge version anyway). So I talked my self into a new one, then talked myself into *this* one because of the 1-hour charge. It shaves well enough, but so does the old one. Returned it and just bought a new cord for the old one.
customer_reviews.author: 100 Watt Walrus

customer_reviews.title: A Cut Above
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a Norelco that I've been using for maybe the last 10 years or more. Very similar to the old one - cuts well, comfortable, feels good in the hand. I like that you can use this as a corded or rechargeable unit. Great convenient when traveling
customer_reviews.author: zakosdad

customer_reviews.title: Bad product
customer_reviews.text: I have bought philips norelco shavers for 50 years and this is the first shaver that didn't last at least 4 years. when I got this shaver I thought something was wrong when I opened it because the cord was not the normal coiled cord that all other shavers came with and this shaver didn't last even 1 year. I bought this shaver in october of 2016 and today is august 2017. I can't prove it but I believe it is not an original Philips Norelco shaver.So if you buy a shaver from Amazon be careful you may not be getting what you think your getting.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis D. Gramenz

customer_reviews.title: So far the shave is great, especially compared to blades that I hadn't replaced ...
customer_reviews.text: I was given a Norelco as a gift 18 years ago. The battery stopped holding charge years ago but the shaver still worked plugged in. It finally gave up the ghost this last week. I bought this model as a replacement since it can be run while plugged in while most cordless shavers will run only from the battery. I'd expect battery life to be a few years, but with the plug-in option I'm looking forward to many more years of operation from this one. So far the shave is great, especially compared to blades that I hadn't replaced for at least five years... What can I say, these things just run and run and run.
customer_reviews.author: James Meacham

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't have very high expectations when I ordered this for my 93 year old father who had just been released from the hospital. The chore of shaving him fell to me and I had poor success with a man's disposable razor. This proved to be a godsend. Easy to use, clean, and charge. Now that Dad is healthier he is holding the shaver himself without any mishaps. And He Looks Sooo Much Better!
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Great shaver for the price
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to replace the same model that i had been using for 3 years. Performs really well, I use it every other day for a clean shave. Works best if you don't use too much pressure and just let the head glide over the skin in small circular motions and making sure the head gets to move with the lay of the hair and not just against and across it. I choose this model over the more expensive and fancier ones particularly because this cordless one has the shave-while-charging feature.
customer_reviews.author: ennar

customer_reviews.title: 9 year old Norelco does a better job
customer_reviews.text: Only had it about 2 weeks so far, so I haven't reached the full "21 days" to get accustomed to it. My thoughts so far are that it doesn't shave very close, and for some reason, the hairs on the right side of my chin cannot be shaved to the same length as the hairs on my left side. Very strange...it takes way more passes to get close to the shave that I can get with my 9 year old norelco, and for already having sensitive skin, the added irritation doesn't help. Probably about 15 minutes at least just to get an "okay" shave. Will most likely return if it doesn't improve. I'll just keep using my old one...
customer_reviews.author: B. Morgan

customer_reviews.title: When I first got it I loved it. However after about 5 months it started ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shaver in July 2017. When I first got it I loved it. However after about 5 months it started loosing it's charge sooner and sooner. Now it won't even run. Having to buy a new one in less than a year. Don't buy it!!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Hedges

customer_reviews.title: Nice shave, but a pain to clean
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace a 30-year old Norelco that finally succumbed to old age. This new one gives a nice quiet shave. But....unlike my old one, one can't just snap the heads off and brush out the detritus. This one requires rinsing with water, and hot water at that. So now I have to waste water while waiting for it to get hot. Then when finished, one is supposed to leave the shaver out with the head open to air-dry. So I can't tuck it away in the drawer until the next use. I haven't had it long enough to comment on battery life.
customer_reviews.author: WxToad

customer_reviews.title: Geez why have I not ditched the blade sooner!?
customer_reviews.text: I'm 21 and have been shaving with a razor since I was 18. Now my facial hair is growing faster than it ever has been and taking the time to shave with a razor was getting tedious every night and it's very important for me to look clean at work. With this Norelco I can have a good enough shave in under a minute and a half. It may not be as close of a shave compared to a blade but no one can tell the difference by looking at you. It's a pretty dang good shave for the convenience. I am soooo in love with this thing it's such a nice luxury to have.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Mills

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy the $200 version this is the same thing shave wise.
customer_reviews.text: Super close shave. I recommend shaving the face with a 0 then using it or use the side piece shaver. After that just a daily 60 seconds of face rubbing should keep you going strong maybe 120 seconds. I am used to growing my facial hair out but flaking keeps happening so going baby face for awhile to see if it helps as I never had the issue daily shaving with a regular razor. Yeah the expensive one flexes on each razor but honestly unless you have super sharp features I don't see it being any more effective just looks cooler and maybe feels cooler but this one is just as good in the actual shave department.
customer_reviews.author: Zarlodious

customer_reviews.title: Won't charge, after only 1 year
customer_reviews.text: I think it should be able to hold a charge for at least 2 years. I have been buying Norelco electric shavers for half a century, I believe, and this is the first time I had this problem. I expect then to last at least 2-3 years. Other than that, I have no complaints; but that is a biggie!! Not sure what model I will order now, but I think I will stay with Norelco. Maybe it is Philips. Not sure when the bought Norelco, but I have noticed over my lifetime that when a good company is bought out, the acquiring company quite often turns a good product into an unreliable one. Just saying.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Like it very much
customer_reviews.text: I've never cared for a cordless electric shaver because I don't have room on my counter to fit the charger. I tried this one that can be used plugged in or not. I'm very happy with it. I shave every morning and night and only plug it in during one of those times every day. It also shaves much closer than my 10+ year old Norelco. The only thing I wish was different is the placement of the on/off button is exactly where your thumb would fit while using it. So it could have been a better design regarding that switch's location. Despite that, it's a great shaver.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: tends to fall apart when cleaning
customer_reviews.text: It shaves fairly well but requires many passes over same area to work. I had the shaver heads fall apart several times when attempting to clean- takes a while to reassemble when this happens.
customer_reviews.author: john chapman

customer_reviews.title: Good, dependable razor brand
customer_reviews.text: I keep coming back to these middle-grade Philips-Norelco razors because they're like an old, comfortable blanket. Sure, there's never a ton of bells and whistles. But frankly, they have been pretty reliable in all aspects for the last 10+ years for me. One word about battery memory. I found out the hard way that if you want one of these batteries to last for more than a year or eighteen months, you need to let the device's power run all the way down to empty before you recharge it. It will give you at least two more years of life for the device.
customer_reviews.author: Lit-nut 79

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product!
customer_reviews.text: I have used Norelco for no less than 30 years. They are an excellent shaver. The ONLY reason I ever had to replace one is because after a few years the blades get dull. I have, on two or three occasions, bought Norelco replacement heads (more than half the price of a new shaver) and they were terrible. It felt like I was shaving with a hedge trimmer. I will never again buy Norelco replacement heads, but will always buy their shavers.
customer_reviews.author: pattyjoe

customer_reviews.title: Works Great and Has Great Battery Life
customer_reviews.text: This shaver has been perfect for me. I have had it for over a year now. It's very easy to use, has never been painful, and I've been thoroughly impressed with the battery life. I have gone 2-3 weeks without charging it and don't even notice a difference in the strength. I love that the whole shaver can get wet, so I never feel like I am ruining it if I rinse off the entire thing. The trimmer on the back side is very convenient as well for trimming thicker facial hair, or even just touching up sideburns and around the ears. Definitely recommend this shaver!
customer_reviews.author: Monahan

customer_reviews.title: Makes Quick Work of Shaving with Excellent Results.
customer_reviews.text: This is actually The " New" model. I bought it for my 16yr old Son, who Would walk around with His face All messy, as Other Electric Razors Took too long, Weren't as Powerful, or as Easy, as This Razor. Typically Electric Razors Can't cut as Close as a Blade, But THIS Razor is NOT The " Typical" Electric Razor! Really Makes quick work of even the Scruffiest of faces. Very powerful, Sharp, Ergonomically Designed, Easy to Clean & Store & has an Extremely Long Battery Life. All at an affordable Price.
customer_reviews.author: Giovanni Sr

customer_reviews.title: Norelco does the job!
customer_reviews.text: I've used Norelco rotary electric razors all my life. I bought this model mostly because it had the same shape as the last one, had a sideburn trimmer, and had an electric cord so I could plug into an outlet. Functionally, there was nothing wrong with my last Norelco; it was still going strong, but looking weathered so replaced it. This model does not fail to impress. I do not have what would be considered a heavy beard, but this razor shaves closer than even my last model ever did, at half the price. An added bonus is that I can rinse it out under hot water and let it drip-dry. Definitely highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good shaver, but NiMH Battery is not ideal.
customer_reviews.text: The shaver is nice. Works well and feels good. But the battery is not lithium and will develop "memory" and eventually stop working. So while it's technically "cordless" today...this feature is temporary. That being said, I can live with the cord at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Not for people who shave once every 1 to 3 months.
customer_reviews.text: Wouldn't expect low quality on a $50 shaver. The trimmer that comes on this weak. Its flimsy which makes it hard to cut off a beard and then shave. It shuts on you. Its fine on the bony parts of your face but once you get to the fatty parts of your face, the trimmer shuts. Very difficult to use this way. I bought this to replace a Norelco that I bought 12 years ago for $40. I see the quality has dropped and the price has been raised.
customer_reviews.author: Matt the Prepper

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: No major complaints. One nitpick with the design is that the protective snap-on cover won't fit on when the shaver top is flipped open for cleaning. So for example if you wanted to rinse it, leave it open to dry, and have the snap cover on while it sits on your counter, can't do that. But i mean, i dont really need to use the cover in the first place. I'll just toss it in the cabinet and use it when i travel. Shaver works well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good combo Razor
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a razor that could run with a charged battery AND would work as a plug in unit. This product more than meets those needs, which is no small thing these days. As others have said, the cord needs to be improved. It is not a flex cord like almost all other razors. The cord is cumbersome to use and is not easy to put away between charges. On the most important issue, the razor provides a good close shave (at least for the first month so far). I am satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce G.

customer_reviews.title: It mostly does what it says...
customer_reviews.text: If you want a razor close shave - use a razor. If you want to be able to keep on top of your beard and yourself looking presentable, this will do just fine. When I use it, I cannot see any beard left, but nor do I feel as smooth as razor shaving - it just isn't likely to happen. If I try to stay on my skin long enough to get there, the rotating blades will irritate my skin. That does not happen when used lightly. So, I would say this is a great product if you use it as a convenience tool. 4 stars for an easy shave with good battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Keith

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: It may have been cheap, but it works poorly AND won't stay charged...why even sell something like this, it soils the brands' name, as it has soiled it for me. And how lame that the return window was so short! I couldn't get the razor to stay charged longer than a couple days with minimal use and because of travel during the limited return window I now can't return this piece of crap. It didn't even shave well during the short periods it was working. Very disappointed. Please, do NOT purchase this razor!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Ricco

customer_reviews.title: Great shaver if just starting puberty.
customer_reviews.text: This is my 6th Norelco, and likely my last. I keep buying them, trusting the improvements in design will result in a smoother shave, with longer lasting blades. This was one of the top rated models, and since I've had so many, my conditioned brain bought the same brand I'm accustomed to buying for my shaving needs. No more. This shaver shaves no closer than the previous models, which is not a close shave, and the blades barely last 4 months. No more Norelco!
customer_reviews.author: WFC

customer_reviews.title: Pretty frustrating to be looking to buy another razor in ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my husband the middle of July and it already quit. Pretty frustrating to be looking to buy another razor in just 5 months.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Razor
customer_reviews.text: Great electric razor, shaves close and does not "pull" hair out of my face as much as other bargain razors. You can run the head of this thing under the water which keeps it clean and like new. I hate cleaning other razors with those little brushes, they never work. I will continue to buy this razor as needed but I suspect it will easily last 2-3 years before needing a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: E. Smith

customer_reviews.title: I hear that they are good for balls on sweaters so this winter I will ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my father who has Alzheimers. He is really shaky and it was time to take away his razors. This did not work at all! He would go over his face and nothing- I would use it on him and this did not shave him. I decided to shave him with a razor and tried to use this around his mouth -- not helpful. I hear that they are good for balls on sweaters so this winter I will give it a shot.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Checks All the Boxes!
customer_reviews.text: The Phillips Norelco 3100 Rechargeable Electric Shaver has exceeded my expectations. GREAT price point (I didn't want to spend a fortune). I haven't owned an electric razor in over 5 decades due to poor performance. I decided to try this one and haven't been sorry after giving it some time before reviewing. The 3100 does not disappoint: good, close shave, insane battery life, easy to clean, great grip, and when it comes time to replace the heads, no advanced engineering degree required. The Phillips Norelco 3100 check all the boxes I was concerned with. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Tom R.

customer_reviews.title: Fits into most hard to reach places and does a good job
customer_reviews.text: I use this product for mowing down the hair on my chest (trimmer attachment) around where I have a port that is used for Chemo treatments. It takes care of the hair growing long and sticking to the adhesive used on the patch that they put around the port area. I also use it to cut the hair that grows up around the colostomy area to keep it from sticking and making it less painful to remove when changing the device a few times a week. I tried another brand but it was too loud and was awkward to hold and didn't fit the intended purpose. Good product
customer_reviews.author: Allan M Povanda

customer_reviews.title: It's almost "The Bomb".
customer_reviews.text: There's a lot of good I can say about this shaver lacking only one important aspect. It frees my time since I can make breakfast while shaving. Cleanup is a breeze. Never a cut or razor burn. Even my pop shaved with a Norelco 60 years ago. The one aspect having been a blade shaver most of my life is truly that you cannot match the closeness of a great blade system! Never. Sincerely, Baby Face Nicholson
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the Price!
customer_reviews.text: No complaints! I returned a Norelco I purchased at Costco, which was more than double the price, to compare it but this one was better for my face. Maybe I am old fashioned as I had to replace my 10 yr old one which was similar to this. For the price it is fantastic! The other feature which seemed odd in some of the new models is that the razors do not work when it's plugged in. This one works both plugged and unplugged. I would recommend this razor.
customer_reviews.author: Ewa

customer_reviews.title: For the person that wants a simple affordable shaver that just shaves, no extra features
customer_reviews.text: Affordable product that works for my needs. Simple straightforward shaver that can be used corded or cordless with about a 45 minute battery. I haven't pushed it to the limits of the battery life, but I shave once a day in the mornings with it and have gone 2 weeks without charging it. Imagine it could have last longer without a charge. Hasn't broken yet. Would recommend if you do not need any crazy features with your shaver and just want a simple affordable one.
customer_reviews.author: James Yein

customer_reviews.title: My unicorn shaver
customer_reviews.text: My search is over. A reasonably priced rotary shaver with a trimmer. It works on battery AND corded. That is a rarity in shavers today. I prefer rotary over foil due to blade cost & durability. I have 3 Norelco shavers right now; 1000, 3000 & 4000 series. This 3000 series shaver is perfect for to the features listed above.
customer_reviews.author: William L. Nale

customer_reviews.title: Philips Norelco Shaver
customer_reviews.text: A fast and convenient way to knock off those whiskers on days when a very close shave isn't needed. I use shaving cream and a bladed razor on days when a close shave is necessary. This cordless shaver charges quickly and holds a charge plus it is a breeze to clean. Well worth what I paid for it.
customer_reviews.author: Ron A.

customer_reviews.title: Bad cut.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my father who has always used Phillip's Norelco but he is very unhappy because does not cut like previous razor.
customer_reviews.author: V. Manning

customer_reviews.title: Glad I upgraded
customer_reviews.text: Just upgraded from my Norelco 5801 XL that I don't even know how many years I've owned. It still works, but I thought I deserved an upgrade. First use of this 3100 and I wish I had upgraded sooner. I use this mainly to do the back of my neck and upper back area. I have coarse hair and this cut so much more easily than my old Norelco which after many years of use, had to make multiple passes to get a clean shave. If I ever abandon my facial stubble, I'll be glad to have this in my arsenal.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: This was made by Norelco ??
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed! I've shaved with a Norelco Electric shaver for more than 20-30 years and have been very satisfied. This latest one cuts like a "hedge trimmer". Does not provide a clean, smooth shave at all like the previous ones that I have bought and used.. My shaving time has tripled and I am still without my usual smooth, facial skin. The motor and charging cycle are fine, but the cutting head "needs work". Possibly the "QC" spec's. should be tightened up. Norelco is a fine brand. They can do better.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 3 months of use
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this shaver. I’m in the military so I used it daily. It worked great! Up until having it for 3 months then it stopped working on me. For an almost $50 item I am very upset that I can no longer use it. Because of that I wish I could give it 0 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Estes Fam

customer_reviews.title: Adequate razor but lasted only 3 months.
customer_reviews.text: First Norelco electric razor lasted for 15 years. Could still use it if I could get a replacement head. I bought this razor in May 2020 and it lasted for 3 months. Went to use it yesterday with the cord and could smell the razor burning. Water must have gotten in somehow while cleaning the previous day and caused the razor to short. Will no longer run with or without cord.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Pros- good batter life, easy to clean, replaceable blades, looks good Cons - overall poor quality, overpriced, prone to cutting skin, terrible at cutting hair Buy something better quality this is garbage I promise you. Heard Manscaped is good
customer_reviews.author: Juden Dave

customer_reviews.title: great razor
customer_reviews.text: The old one I inherited from my grandfather finally gave up the ghost. I opted for the plug in variety because batteries can be fickle and I need something that I can give my grandkids. It's a little tough on sensitive skin, gives me bumps and redness but so do blades. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: mark henderson

customer_reviews.title: Like this razor!
customer_reviews.text: So smooth and so pleasant. I did a free throw into my paper basket with the old one. It lasted over 4 years ,until the motor goes, they work fine. I buy the least expensive razor with the items I want. Never ever buy a extra warranty. The new items r 90 days at least here but once a thing goes over 90 days and worlks good chance it will work 2 or 3 years. Save your bucks!
customer_reviews.author: Lds1911

customer_reviews.title: Great razor for the money
customer_reviews.text: Does a great job and has a long battery life. I have owned more expensive razors but this does the best job. It doesn't have all of the "whistles" but this was not a factor for me. Great razor for the money and the replacement blades are quite cheap, in comparison with other models.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of junk. It is worse than a toy. Hardly takes a charge, the shave is terrible. It is like a toy. I should have known you don't buy the low end in such products. If you buy it, you'll be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Sherrett

customer_reviews.title: Not what I wanted, I guess. I wanted ...
customer_reviews.text: Not what I wanted, I guess. I wanted something that could shave me down to stubble length, but this razor is trying (awkwardly, imo) to do a true to the skin shave. I don't know how anyone would prefer this to a quick shave with a mach 3 or something
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and offers a smooth shave
customer_reviews.text: My husband had a Norelco shaver for years, but it finally stopped working. I bought this one for him because it was similar to his last one. He likes it just as well, if not somewhat better than the last one he had. He says it’s easy to use, charges easily and offers a nice smooth shave.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Repeat buy
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I have bought this very shaver. I love the value of the unit. The last one literally lasted 6 years of day in and day out shaving for me. It has been the best shaver. it has always cut well and has been super easy to clean and operate. I love the battery life and rarely find my self having to charge the battery again. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: drapercastle

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this. I am allergic to shaving creams so the electric razor really helps me. I have tried a couple and have not been pleased. This one works great. I am a female and use it on my legs. Gets my legs very smooth. The battery lasts a long time. Much longer than I expected. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Hale

customer_reviews.title: Wowness!
customer_reviews.text: This is absolutely the best shaver I've ever used. I usually have a lot of stubble after using all sorts of electric shavers. But this one? My face hasn't felt this smooth since I was 13 years old lol. Great product and great price.
customer_reviews.author: Ty

customer_reviews.title: Way better than I expected.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this razor to replace a Remington razor that I got a couple years ago. Based on the Remington, I didn't expect much out of a new razor. What I received is an amazing improvement over the Remington. This razor is the best I've ever had. After a few weeks I still haven't charged it second time. And I can shave in about a quarter of the time the old one took. I love this product.
customer_reviews.author: Tractorman

customer_reviews.title: Good shaver
customer_reviews.text: My father likes this shaver. It does a great job. However, the blades do not seem to last very long and we have to purchase new ones quite often. that is the only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed. Amazing how much better my 20 year old ...
customer_reviews.text: Philips Norelco Electric Shaver 3100 - Did not shave well at all. Shaved for about 20 minutes - still could not get anywhere near an acceptable shave. Had to stop because my face was so irritated. Very disappointed. Amazing how much better my 20 year old Remington TF100 is. I think anyone who has used old school electric razors will not like this product.
customer_reviews.author: ccw2000

customer_reviews.title: This shaves noticeably slower than my last shaver. And ...
customer_reviews.text: This shaves noticeably slower than my last shaver. And not being able to use it with cream or water is a downside. But it does the job. The comfort blades are a bit gentler.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best deal in the Norelco lineup.
customer_reviews.text: Very good shaver and probably the best bargain in the Norelco lineup. I purchased the RQ9 replacement head to go with this shaver, as that is the best head Norelco makes at this time. Too bad they no longer offer a shaver equipped with with this head. See my other review on the Norelco 12PRO replacement head.
customer_reviews.author: Sly

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is not my first Norelco shaver. Always had good luck with them. I don't grow a thick beard, however at my age the stubbles are very fine hairs. And Norelco rotary shavers have not disappointed me ever.
customer_reviews.author: Rendall Siegers

customer_reviews.title: Because my Old 30 year old Norelco elect still work like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I have not purchased a elct saver in over 25 years. Because my Old 30 year old Norelco elect still work like a charm.If it work why throw it out. But this new one her give me the closest shave even using blades. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Bodnar

customer_reviews.title: Works great, better after a couple of weeks of use.
customer_reviews.text: I've got a very light beard, but have to shave every day. I was afraid this was underpowered, but it shaves me with no problems at all. It seems to get sharper the more I use it and shaves closer now that I've had it for a few weeks than it did when it was new.
customer_reviews.author: Duane

customer_reviews.title: Works great and has a good battery life
customer_reviews.text: Great product. It cuts hairs quickly and has a battery life that is definitely longer than what is specified. I usually charge it once a month and I use it every other day. It is quick and easy to clean. The only downside is that recharging may take a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Brown Dragon

customer_reviews.title: High end electric razor.
customer_reviews.text: This electric razor is quite unique in the fact that it has an feature that alot of other electronic razors. It allows you to use it as it is charging. Blades are fine enough to get a very close shave without worrying about getting cut. The battery life us ridiculous as well. It last for quite some time.
customer_reviews.author: DeAndre Adams

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Would not recommend. Flip trimmer is weak and doesn't work well. Main shaver is uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy C.

customer_reviews.title: I have been using this brand for 50 yrs and this is the worst one ever
customer_reviews.text: battery sounds weak , very poor shave just not much good
customer_reviews.author: don't know what this is

customer_reviews.title: Best Basic cord/cordless shaver
customer_reviews.text: You will not a x10 better shave from a x10 greater cost shaver than this basic, effective, really great shaver. The first charge was just like the energiser bunny; I thought my wife had recharged it for me after the second week. Nothing bad to say about this shaver. Just get it and get on with life.
customer_reviews.author: oldnavysubnuke

customer_reviews.title: can use it while charging and sideburn trimmer is excellent. Always was a fan of the Norelco shaver
customer_reviews.text: We paid the extra $10 for this upgraded version of the basic shaver. More than worth the price. Battery lasts longer, can use it while charging and sideburn trimmer is excellent. Always was a fan of the Norelco shaver. Now even more!
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Best Razor for the $
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME RAZOR! Does a great job, super easy to clean, holds a charge for a long time, nice LED charging light that tells you charging level, and the rubber portion on handle makes it "no slip". Love it. I don't know why anyone would want to spend any more for a razor.
customer_reviews.author: Boz

customer_reviews.title: Super quality at a bargain price.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this shaver for over five years. It is amazing. The battery charges in less than an hour and lasts over a month. Super easy to use and clean and you cannot cut yourself! You get a fast, close shave.
customer_reviews.author: NEWSGIVER

customer_reviews.title: She’d some light on things
customer_reviews.text: My father has extremely low vision, but can see if he has a very bright light. I had him put the light on his keys so that he would always have the extra light he needed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Razor! (for me)
customer_reviews.text: I don't have a heavy growth of facial hair, so this razor was more than adequate for my needs even without trying it first. Having tried it once, I can find no cons in this product. It meets my needs very well and overall I am very satisfied with the purchase. Hopefully, it will last for a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: L. Cyr

customer_reviews.title: A guy approves
customer_reviews.text: I've used the wahl shaver. This ones seems to get closer. I'm not entirely sold on the feel yet but theres literally nothing wrong with this shaver for me. I can't use blades because my skin can't handle it. This one can also take awhile to shave when you want to get very close.
customer_reviews.author: A guy

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: I can't get a REALLY close shave with this - at least not like I can with a disposable razor. It is convenient to use, and being able to wash it off in the sink is cool. I will try something different next time.
customer_reviews.author: Rymonster

customer_reviews.title: This one shaves good as any
customer_reviews.text: Been a Norelco user 30 years. This one shaves good as any. Takes 8 hours to recharge & needs recharging sooner than earliers. I see this as evidence of reduction in mfgr-ing cost.
customer_reviews.author: Robert H. Mccrory

customer_reviews.title: and easy to use for trips
customer_reviews.text: Holds a charge well, small, light, and easy to use for trips. I mainly use a hand razor and bought this for a quick shave when needed, or traveling. It's no quicker than a hand razor, as it takes about 15 passes to get the hair though, and is not really an improvement from my old electric razor, which is about 9 years old. Was hoping for a bit more, but it works.
customer_reviews.author: G. Fryer

customer_reviews.title: OK Razor but not a close shave
customer_reviews.text: Good shaver. I replaced my old Norelco with this one. The old one shaved closer than this new one, but this new one was less expensive. It's ok but I still have to use a razor for a close shave, not so with the older model Norelco - it cut as close as a blade.
customer_reviews.author: J. Dixon

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Good quality for an amazing price. I broke a $100 Norelco model that it's main feature is that can be use under water. Never needed it so I'm so happy with this one I bought to replace it. I don't know if it's just because it's brand new but the shave is better than the expensive one.
customer_reviews.author: Jose C.

customer_reviews.title: Replaced my old Norelce I got in the early 1980's.
customer_reviews.text: I hope this one last as long as the old unit. I just could no longer get replacement cutter heads and the batteries were getting hard to get so I upgraded. Shaves great and so far the battery charge is holding great, once every three to four weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: great price and great product
customer_reviews.text: My family loves this shaver. Amazon is great with no shipping fees and speedy delivery. I will keep purchasing items on amazon. Thank you my third one like this
customer_reviews.author: Geny Dickens

customer_reviews.title: It just doesn't shave close enough.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my old 30+ year old unit. This new one is quieter than my old one but it doesn't shave as close, but it is much easier to clean.
customer_reviews.author: G. Maddox

customer_reviews.title: Not a good shaver. Save you money for a better one.
customer_reviews.text: Not a good shaver. I gave mine to goodwill after using it for 1 week. Poor shaves and noisy. Better to apply your money toward a higher quality product.
customer_reviews.author: SalC

customer_reviews.title: Philps Norelco Electric Shaver
customer_reviews.text: My husband likes it. It replaces another Norelco which was losing its umph. He says this one charges better and hold the charge longer. This was the only one that can be used with the cord which is especially nice if one forgets to plug it in to charge!
customer_reviews.author: Photo Belle

customer_reviews.title: Compared to foil shavers, this fails to cut
customer_reviews.text: This is my first rotary shaver. Perhaps this model is great and I purchased a lemon, but it fails to cut. After reading instructions, 20 minutes of attempted shaving, and 20 minutes of internet videos I gave up. Back to foil shavers for me. I tried to return this through Norelco's "money back guarantee". Norelco's process is so arduous that I was ultimately unsuccessful—and will never buy another Norelco product. Fortunately Amazon handled the return without issue. Thanks Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Good value and works great!
customer_reviews.text: Really great little razor. Over many years, this is my third and by far the best Norelco I've owned. It charges up in no time, it's whisper quiet, hot water cleans out the head after shaving, it's light weight and shaves me better than any blade razor.
customer_reviews.author: Piezo

customer_reviews.title: Loud Noise
customer_reviews.text: After about 40 days of use the razor began to make loud noise. The Amazon return window had closed. I called Norelc,o and they offered refund, but customer has to pay for shipping. Do not buy this product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality and reliability
customer_reviews.text: After an experiment with a highly recomended *brand* shaver, I am back to Norelco for good. My first one lasted over 10 years, no idea why I decided to try another brand, but it lasted less that 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: Glynn jones

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 3 of these. They are overpriced and cheaply made. The heads and internal plastic clips fall apart and break. these were gifts. broken in less than 45 days.
customer_reviews.author: rbettger

customer_reviews.title: Good if you’re not the kind of guy that has to shave daily
customer_reviews.text: Didnt like the blades my older model would cut smoother and leave less hairs.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel C.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect shaver
customer_reviews.text: The best part about this shaver is that it has a cord so you can use it both ways--with or without the cord. This is a traditional feature that a lot of shavers have abandoned. Now I don't have to worry about keeping the shaver charged. BTW, I'm a woman and I use this on my legs. Easy to clean with a flip top. It does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy Sylvie

customer_reviews.title: The head does not pivot and the battery indicator is not as nice as I've seen on my past Norelcos
customer_reviews.text: I lost my 8 year old Norelco razor at a hotel so I ordered a new one, this one. But I didn't do my research. This one is a base model and feels really cheap. The head does not pivot and the battery indicator is not as nice as I've seen on my past Norelcos. I should have just waited and bought whatever Costco was carrying.
customer_reviews.author: Edward A. King

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: Great little shaver from Norelco a little noisy but I don't shave every day I have found the best way to clean a shaver like this is to take it outside and clean it with canned air works great
customer_reviews.author: t wilen

customer_reviews.title: most important to know I received it
customer_reviews.text: have norco razors before but I can't give you a rating because I just received it and is still on the caharger
customer_reviews.author: John H Dyer

customer_reviews.title: Good razor
customer_reviews.text: I have used earlier models of Norelco razors similar to this one. I find the 3100 to more aggressive, more noisy, and physically lighter. My older razor gave me a smoother shave.
customer_reviews.author: Robert M. Wood

customer_reviews.title: Won't lie flat
customer_reviews.text: My only gripe with this shaver is that there is no flat spot on it to lay it securely on the bathroom shelf. It wants to roll over and I'm waiting for it to hit the floor.
customer_reviews.author: T. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Not a big fan, and would not buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this electric shaver to have while living on the road. It takes about 15 minutes to get my face shaved with this one. I went back to my razor and only use this if I absolutely have to. I would not buy again, and expected a lot better of a product. The side burn clipper works well on it, and it holds a good charge.
customer_reviews.author: Midgley's Favorites

product_meta.title: Philips Norelco Shaver 3100 Rechargeable Electric Shaver with Pop-up Trimmer, S3310/81
product_meta.description:
Style Name:Electric shaver 3100The Shaver 3100 gives you an easy and convenient shave with more comfort for an affordable price. Its 4-direction Flex Heads, combined with Comfort Cut Blade System, guarantees a smooth result.

BRAND STORY
By Philips
feature_bullets: Enjoy an easy and convenient shave with more comfort at an affordable price.
The blades' rounded edges move smoothly over your skin for a more comfortable shave.
Heads flex in 4 directions to easily shave every curve of your face and neck.
With the one-touch opening, you can easily rinse the shaver clean under the tap.
The rechargeable Lithium-ion battery delivers the power of a corded shaver without the hassle of a cord. 45 minutes of shaving time, with an LED battery indicator.
Comfortable, easy shave; The Shaver 3100 gives you an easy and convenient shave with more comfort for an affordable price.
ComfortCut Blade System- Rounded edges move smoothly over skin for a protective shave.
4 direction Flex Heads; Heads flex in 4 directions to easily shave every curve of your face and neck

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
